title: Queentoshi
author: Queentoshi
content: Our children will not be as lucky as we are, we have to help them to know about bitcoins on time so they can have some for themselves. We are lucky because we are of age to know and understand what bitcoin is at this time when the value of bitcoins is still expected to increase not like our children who have no idea and it may be too late for them to make any gain from bitcoin when they finally know about bitcoins if you leave them. A good gift any parent can give to their children for their future is to enlighten their children about bitcoins so they have some knowledge about it at an early age and buy some for the children even before they can begin to get for themselves. What do you think?

comments.author: notocactus
comments.body: Quote from: Queentoshi on May 25, 2023, 02:51:01 PMOur children will not be as lucky as we are, we have to help them to know about bitcoins on time so they can have some for themselves.Don't force your children to become Bitcoin investors and let them free to choose what they want to do. You can educate them about Bitcoin but give your children freedom to make decisions.QuoteWe are lucky because we are of age to know and understand what bitcoin is at this time when the value of bitcoins is still expected to increase not like our children who have no idea and it may be too late for them to make any gain from bitcoin when they finally know about bitcoins if you leave them.Do you think Bitcoin will stop its growth next 20 years? If you are thinking so, invest in Bitcoin now looks to be not a good investment decision. I can not give you financial advice for future, as I myself don't know about future, but if you think about Bitcoin future like this, don't invest in it.QuoteA good gift any parent can give to their children for their future is to enlighten their children about bitcoins so they have some knowledge about it at an early age and buy some for the children even before they can begin to get for themselves. What do you think?You can do something for your children by yourself. Work, spend less money for your expenses and have more savings which can be used to buy some bitcoins as inheritance for your children.

comments.body: You can educate your children about bitcoin, but you have to let them know that it is also very risky as it is very profitable to invest in bitcoin too. But if not selling very early and wait, the price of bitcoin will increase. But it is better to deal with bitcoin like a risk asset.

comments.author: CryptSafe
comments.body: This is a good move OP. You see, bitcoin is still at the early stage of which I believe you know that. The price currently is still worth investing. Going by your statement, I feel the best way to do that is to start accumulating bitcoin bit by bit for your kids now why you teach them gradually how the system works. As they grow, their knowledge about bitcoin is getting vast and experience would teach them many things about it. While all these are going on, the little bitcoin you have bought for them keeps appreciating because for sure it would grow bigger than it is now by then they would have something to fall to or maybe an inheritance left for them to inherit.

comments.author: Upgrade00
comments.body: Financial education is one way to help prepare your kids for the future, and it involves a whole lot more than just Bitcoin. Train your kids to understand how money works including fiat, gold, crypto or any other medium of exchange. If they understand the different financial markets they would be able to know how to profit from it and avoid losses.If you're going to teach your kids about Bitcoin, do not focus on the price and exchange activities. The utility of Bitcoin would be more in demand in the future than now and knowing the basics of how it works would be useful to them.

comments.body: Quote from: gantez on May 25, 2023, 05:19:37 PMIt is not until you teach your children about bitcoin that they will develop the interest for it because some children grow up and have different thing in mind that will take the attention away. Parents can invest into bitcoin for the children if they wish like savings for them that you do in the bank and when the children is adult enough the coin can be handed down so if the children has interest will begin from that point. People that you force in can force out themselves if no interest in it.People pick different route in life, but also the road step upon by children are mostly shaped or carved by the knowledge they acquire at a younger age or the environment they live in. OP’s idea of teaching his kids about bitcoin isn’t bad but I would just say the education should be based on financial education and not only bitcoin. The children should know how to save, safeguard their funds and how well to spend each them. I believe knowledge like this will definitely lead some towards bitcoin not necessarily till you tell them about it. Also a parent could just open up a wallet and save some bitcoins in future for the children but all investments shouldn’t be in bitcoin only, there other store of values that it could be diversified to. More so I don’t think our children will miss out like that on bitcoin, because if we look at the halving period, although 98% of bitcoin will be mined around 2030, it will take the year 2140 before mining of it is stopped which way to long for our children not to Benefit from it, but as they say the early bird catches the morning worms.

comments.author: Dzwaafu11
comments.body: Quote from: Queentoshi on May 25, 2023, 02:51:01 PMOur children will not be as lucky as we are, we have to help them to know about bitcoins on time so they can have some for themselves. We are lucky because we are of age to know and understand what bitcoin is at this time when the value of bitcoins is still expected to increase not like our children who have no idea and it may be too late for them to make any gain from bitcoin when they finally know about bitcoins if you leave them. I'm confident that in the future, adoption of bitcoin will surpass that of it at the moment, but you shouldn't worry about our children being as successful in the cryptocurrency market right now as we were because I'm confident that they will stand to gain more from it than we did. This is because we all think that the price of bitcoin will increase from where it is at the moment and that there may be additional ways to use it and other cryptocurrencies in the future. Quote from: Queentoshi on May 25, 2023, 02:51:01 PMA good gift any parent can give to their children for their future is to enlighten their children about bitcoins so they have some knowledge about it at an early age and buy some for the children even before they can begin to get for themselves. What do you think?Our children will have different futures, so I don't believe it's a good idea to teach them about bitcoin. This is because we can't force anyone to work in the bitcoin industry against their will, and I don't believe that a child can learn everything there is to know about bitcoin. Instead, I believe that they must first learn how to manage their finances and other essential skills. As you may already be aware, purchasing bitcoin for a child will not be a simple process. If you take family responsibility seriously and consider purchasing some bitcoin for your child, I believe that is a mistake you should not do, especially if your earning potential is low.

comments.author: tabas
comments.body: It is inheritance and we all want our children not to suffer from future financial crisis and this has prepared us to think like this. Especially, people that have experienced poverty and have been fortunate to know Bitcoin at an early time and still holding up to this moment. As you have said OP, we can teach and educate them about Bitcoin as early as they can be. But, it's still up to these kids if they'll be interested on what we're teaching them which is anything related to BTC/Blockchain. These young folks have got unpredictable decisions and interest as they grow older but as long as we're able to tell them that there's this great piece of tech and not just a tech but also an asset, a store of value and a way to transfer wealth and that's Bitcoin.

comments.author: Rigon
comments.body: We learned about Bitcoin the hard way. Yes it will take much less time to educate our kids about Bitcoin. Since no one helped us learn about Bitcoin, we took the hard work of learning Bitcoin on our own. Then I was able to study here with great difficulty. However, I would not let my child learn about Bitcoin at such a young age. If my child is fit, I will teach him about Bitcoin. Because at this educational age, if Bitcoin is educated in education, his attention to education will decrease. He cannot be a human being. So I think it's not just about me it's every person should educate their children in bitcoin education when they are adults.
